intro: Koanophyllon coixtlahuacum, commonly known as the Mexican leafy spurge, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant has hairy stems and leaves that are often covered in fine pubescence. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, typically found in rocky soils. Koanophyllon coixtlahuacum is known for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for small insects.
